p: The DRGs included in the category “other DRGs” were different according to the age‐group. In the youngest, the most frequent “other DRGs” were related to neurology, with “seizure/epilepsy” accounting for 25% in the <20 years. In age‐group 20‐39 years, “other DRGs” were mostly related to pregnancy (52%). In other age‐groups, the most frequent “other DRGs” were related to cardio‐vascular conditions (18% in the 40‐59 years, 24% in the 60‐79 years, and 34% in the ≥80 years).
